q: African military chiefs said they were on standby if called-- although neighbouring countries appear a long way from agreement on using force to oust Gbagbo after a Nov. 28 election which U.N.-certified results show he lost. Everyone realises that the only solution is to make Mr Laurent Gbagbo leave with other measures, including force, Alassane Ouattara said, a day after the latest African mediation efforts led by Kenyan premier Raila Odinga collapsed. Alassane Ouattara was speaking in the grounds of his base in the Golf Hotel, a sprawling lagoon-side resort whose palm

- LONDON( Reuters)- The British prime minister's communications chief Andy Coulson resigned on Friday, as prosecutors stepped up their inquiries into illegal phone hacking at a tabloid newspaper when he was editor. We confirm that Andy Coulson has resigned, an official in Prime Minister David Cameron 's office said. Andy Coulson was a key part of David Cameron 's inner circle after joining the Conservative leader's team when in opposition in 2007.

Iraq. The differences weren't personal, Donald Rumsfeld said. He recalled receiving a book that Henry Kissinger had written, with the inscription,`` To an occasional adversary and a permanent friend.'' When I started working on the book, Henry Kissinger said,` You tell it like it was.' We differed on some issues, and there's nothing wrong with that. It was professional and healthy, Donald Rumsfeld said. Working on the book meant second-guessing his memory. In 1983, Donald Rumsfeld was a special Middle East envoy for George H. W.
